presentation.title: Hi, I'm a Full Stack Developer !
presentation.phrase: I possess {{years}} years of programming experience. While my primary focus is on Back-End development, I cannot deny my passion for crafting captivating interfaces on the Front-End.

about-info.name: My name is Paulo Marques Gonçalves, I'm {{years}} years old.
about-info.phrase: I work as a systems analyst at Banco Original, where I am involved in Back-End development using Java and microservices. I also perform maintenance on the Front-End, utilizing HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Currently, I am pursuing a degree in Systems Analysis and Development at the São Paulo Technology College (FATEC-SP).
about-info.location: Brazil - BR | São Paulo - SP | East Zone - EZ

0.react: React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces, known for its declarative and efficient approach to creating interactive UI components in web applications.

0.html5: HTML (HyperText Markup Language) is the standard markup language for creating and structuring web content. It defines the structure of a webpage using elements such as headings, paragraphs, and links.

0.css3: CSS (Cascading Style Sheets) is a stylesheet language used to control the presentation and layout of HTML documents. It allows developers to style elements, creating visually appealing and responsive web designs.

0.javascript: JavaScript is a versatile scripting language commonly used for client-side web development. It enables dynamic content, interactivity, and the manipulation of the Document Object Model (DOM) in web browsers.

0.typescript: TypeScript is a superset of JavaScript that adds static typing to the language. It enhances code maintainability and developer productivity by catching errors during development and providing better tooling support.

0.bootstrap: Bootstrap is a popular front-end framework that simplifies the process of designing responsive and mobile-first websites. It includes pre-designed components and a responsive grid system, facilitating rapid development.

0.angularjs: Angular is a comprehensive front-end framework developed by Google for building dynamic and scalable web applications. It provides a modular structure, two-way data binding, and a set of powerful tools for developers.

1.java: Java is a versatile and robust programming language, known for its portability and wide application in software development, from mobile applications to complex enterprise systems.

1.spring: Spring is a powerful Java framework used for building scalable and easily maintainable enterprise applications. It provides comprehensive features for agile development, including dependency injection and transaction management.

1.mysql: MySQL stands out as a reliable and efficient relational database management system. Widely used, it is known for its speed, reliability, and flexibility, making it a popular choice for web and enterprise applications.

1.php: PHP is a widely-used scripting language for developing dynamic web pages. Its simplicity, integration with HTML, and support for various databases make it a popular choice for creating interactive websites.

1.cplusplus: C++ is a powerful and efficient programming language, widely adopted for developing high-performance systems and applications. With features such as object-oriented programming and direct memory manipulation, it is a robust choice for demanding projects.

2.intellij: IntelliJ is a powerful integrated development environment (IDE) for Java, known for its intelligent code assistance, advanced navigation, and robust tools.

2.vscode: VSCode, or Visual Studio Code, is a lightweight yet feature-rich code editor developed by Microsoft. It supports various languages and extensions, providing a versatile environment for developers.

2.git: Git is a distributed version control system widely used for tracking changes in source code during software development. It enables collaboration and facilitates managing code repositories efficiently.

2.github: GitHub is a web-based platform that utilizes Git for version control. It serves as a hosting service for software development projects, fostering collaboration and providing tools for project management.

2.gitlab: GitLab is a web-based Git repository manager that provides source code management, CI/CD (Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment), and collaboration features. It offers an all-in-one solution for the development lifecycle.

2.confluence: Confluence is a collaboration and documentation tool that enables teams to create, share, and collaborate on content. It is particularly useful for creating and organizing project documentation and knowledge bases.
